meanings.definition: To plant trees on (land) that has been deforested.
meanings.sent1: The community group reafforests the park to bring back the trees.
meanings.sent2: The environmental organization reafforests the mountains to combat deforestation.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels were surprised when humans reafforested their favorite play area.
meanings.sent4: She reafforests the barren land with hope and determination.
meanings.sent5: The sound of shovels hitting the ground fills the air as the volunteers reafforest the area.

meanings.definition: To restore (an area) to a forested state by planting trees.
meanings.sent1: After the wildfire, the conservationists reafforest the burnt forest.
meanings.sent2: The government agency reafforests the national park to protect the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they helped reafforest the school garden.
meanings.sent4: Her love for nature drives her to reafforest the deforested land.
meanings.sent5: The old farmer's wrinkled hands carefully reafforest the family orchard.
